subject: p14841168
History: Post ERCP, fever and cough, evaluate for atelectasis or pneumonia.
Findings: One portable upright AP view of the chest. The right PICC line has been pulled back and now ends proximal to the junction of the right subclavian and right internal jugular vein. Mild-to-moderate cardiomegaly is stable. Mild pulmonary venous engorgement and mediastinal widening is stable. There is no pulmonary edema or pneumonia. Pleural effusions are small if any.
Impression: No evidence of pneumonia. Right PICC line has been pulled back now and now ends just proximal to the junction of the right subclavian and right internal jugular vein. Mild pulmonary venous engorgement and mild mediastinal widening are stable.
